page.title: 02THREE VILLAGES, WENSLEYDALE
page.content: There are three villages in our area, Aysgarth, Thoralby and West Burton. All three were recorded in the Domesday Book and all were in the land of Earl Allan of Richmond. Aysgarth had "three carucates and two ploughs. Cnut had a manor there. Gosfrid now has it". Thoralby had "six carucates and four ploughs". West Burton had " six carucates and four ploughs." Bernulf and Gosfrid owned the manors respectively. The houses in the villages and the surrounding farms are now almost all owned by the people who live in them. There are a few tenant farmers and in each village there are a few houses owned by the local council. In Thoralby there are some council bungalows for the elderly. In all the villages there are several holiday cottages owned by local people but rented out to holiday-makers.
